          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }
        h3 {
          margin-top: 1em;
        }
        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>
              
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;
        }
        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {
          display: none;
        }
        mr-phase {
          margin-bottom: 0.75em;
        }
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;
          display: flex;
          flex-flow: column;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          align-items: stretch;

        mr-launch-overview[hidden] {

    <mr-launch-overview class="main-item" hidden=""><!---->
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      <style>
        mr-launch-overview {
          max-width: 100%;

          Note:<b>Note:</b>
          Clock icons indicate that users may not be available.
          Tooltips show the reason.

          <b>Note:</b>
          Clock icons indicate that users may not be available.

      UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/86.0.4240.53 Safari/537.36<span class="line"><!---->UserAgent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 10.0; Win64; x64) AppleWebKit/537.36 (KHTML, like Gecko) Chrome/86.0.4240.53 Safari/537.36<!----></span><br><br>Steps to reproduce the problem:<span class="line"><!---->Steps to reproduce the problem:<!----></span><br>1. Load test.html<span class="line"><!---->1. Load test.html<!----></span><br>2. Observe that Broken never gets a performance entry<span class="line"><!---->2. Observe that Broken never gets a performance entry<!----></span><br><br>What is the expected behavior?<span class="line"><!---->What is the expected behavior?<!----></span><br>I expect all cases to generate a performance entry as it does in Firefox and IE (I'm not able to test Safari).<span class="line"><!---->I expect all cases to generate a performance entry as it does in Firefox and IE (I'm not able to test Safari).<!----></span><br><br>What went wrong?<span class="line"><!---->What went wrong?<!----></span><br>The broken iframe does not have an entry.<span class="line"><!---->The broken iframe does not have an entry.<!----></span><br><br>Did this work before? No <span class="line"><!---->Did this work before? No <!----></span><br><br>Does this work in other browsers? Yes<span class="line"><!---->Does this work in other browsers? Yes<!----></span><br><br>Chrome version: 86.0.4240.53  Channel: beta<span class="line"><!---->Chrome version: 86.0.4240.53  Channel: beta<!----></span><br>OS Version: 10.0<span class="line"><!---->OS Version: 10.0<!----></span><br>Flash Version: <span class="line"><!---->Flash Version: <!----></span><br><br>This seems related to <span class="line"><!---->This seems related to <!----></span>Issue 460879<a class="strike-through" target="_blank" href="/p/chromium/issues/detail?id=460879" title="[Resource Timing] Missing PerformanceResourceTiming entries for Requests that don't receive a Response"><!---->Issue 460879<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>but specifically for iframes. It doesn't seem like iframes were specifically excluded in <span class="line"><!---->but specifically for iframes. It doesn't seem like iframes were specifically excluded in <!----></span>https://github.com/w3c/resource-timing/issues/12<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://github.com/w3c/resource-timing/issues/12"><!---->https://github.com/w3c/resource-timing/issues/12<!----></a>.<span class="line"><!---->.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        <!---->

      </div><br>
    
        
      
        We do need an entry for a failed request, as it is a security problem to enable distinguishing between successful and failed fetches. From what I understand the iframe entries are created from Navigation Timing for the iframe:<span class="line"><!---->We do need an entry for a failed request, as it is a security problem to enable distinguishing between successful and failed fetches. From what I understand the iframe entries are created from Navigation Timing for the iframe:<!----></span><br><br>DocumentLoader::BodyLoadingFinished<span class="line"><!---->DocumentLoader::BodyLoadingFinished<!----></span><br>RemoteFrameOwner::AddResourceTiming<span class="line"><!---->RemoteFrameOwner::AddResourceTiming<!----></span><br>RenderFrameHostImpl::ForwardResourceTimingToParent<span class="line"><!---->RenderFrameHostImpl::ForwardResourceTimingToParent<!----></span><br><br>Obviously we don't need/have a NavigationTiming entry for an iframe that does not end up existing. But I imagine DocumentLoader will still exist for a failed iframe? Is it possible for loader folks to call the AddResourceTiming method on failure as well?<span class="line"><!---->Obviously we don't need/have a NavigationTiming entry for an iframe that does not end up existing. But I imagine DocumentLoader will still exist for a failed iframe? Is it possible for loader folks to call the AddResourceTiming method on failure as well?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The cause for this seems to be:<span class="line"><!---->The cause for this seems to be:<!----></span><br>* The response that DocumentLoader gets for the error iframe is a chrome-error:// scheme, so not reported (we only report HTTP pages)<span class="line"><!---->* The response that DocumentLoader gets for the error iframe is a chrome-error:// scheme, so not reported (we only report HTTP pages)<!----></span><br>* Even if we were to report it, the response URL is the error URL, not the original request URL.<span class="line"><!---->* Even if we were to report it, the response URL is the error URL, not the original request URL.<!----></span><br><br>I'm taking a stab at fixing this.<span class="line"><!---->I'm taking a stab at fixing this.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The pending fix is:<span class="line"><!---->The pending fix is:<!----></span><br>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567925<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567925"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567925<!----></a><br>which make error documents to reveal informations to their parents, the same way normal documents does.<span class="line"><!---->which make error documents to reveal informations to their parents, the same way normal documents does.<!----></span><br><br>So to fix the cross-origin leak, we need to send more data toward the cross-origin parent? This sounds counter-intuitive at first, and potentially risky, since those are internal pages. We need to double check the cure is not worse than the disease.<span class="line"><!---->So to fix the cross-origin leak, we need to send more data toward the cross-origin parent? This sounds counter-intuitive at first, and potentially risky, since those are internal pages. What kind of new data will be sent to the parent?<span class="line"><!---->I don't know anything about the PerformanceObserver, so I can't help much.         > So to fix the cross-origin leak, we need to send more data toward the cross-origin parent? <span class="line"><!---->&gt; So to fix the cross-origin leak, we need to send more data toward the cross-origin parent? <!----></span><br><br>Yes. As this information is exposed for iframes, not exposing it for some reveals information about them.<span class="line"><!---->Yes. As this information is exposed for iframes, not exposing it for some reveals information about them.<!----></span><br><br>> We need to double check the cure is not worse than the disease.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; We need to double check the cure is not worse than the disease.<!----></span><br><br>Makes sense to be sure.<span class="line"><!---->Makes sense to be sure.<!----></span><br><br>> What kind of new data will be sent to the parent?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; What kind of new data will be sent to the parent?<!----></span><br><br>We do report non-null startTime, fetchStart, responseEnd and duration, where startTime==fetchStart and duration == (responseEnd - fetchStart)<span class="line"><!---->We do report non-null startTime, fetchStart, responseEnd and duration, where startTime==fetchStart and duration == (responseEnd - fetchStart)<!----></span><br><br>name is the pre-redirect, pre-error URL<span class="line"><!---->name is the pre-redirect, pre-error URL<!----></span><br><br>> To be worthwhile doing, the new data should be indistinguishable from non-error pages. Is it the case?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; To be worthwhile doing, the new data should be indistinguishable from non-error pages. Is it the case?<!----></span><br><br>I believe so, other than timing attacks. But the current values I see would make sense also for non-error pages. (i.e. they are not extremely low)<span class="line"><!---->I believe so, other than timing attacks. But the current values I see would make sense also for non-error pages. (i.e. they are not extremely low)<!----></span><br><br>As the CL is now ready to land, let me know if y'all think it's safe to do.<span class="line"><!---->As the CL is now ready to land, let me know if y'all think it's safe to do.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug requires manual review: M88's targeted beta branch promotion date has already passed, so this requires manual review<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: M88's targeted beta branch promotion date has already passed, so this requires manual review<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7.           Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Blink>HTML>IFrame Blink>Loader
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Blink&gt;HTML&gt;IFrame Blink&gt;Loader
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        We do need an entry for a failed request, as it is a security problem to enable distinguishing between successful and failed fetches. From what I understand the iframe entries are created from Navigation Timing for the iframe:<span class="line"><!---->We do need an entry for a failed request, as it is a security problem to enable distinguishing between successful and failed fetches. From what I understand the iframe entries are created from Navigation Timing for the iframe:<!----></span><br><br>DocumentLoader::BodyLoadingFinished<span class="line"><!---->DocumentLoader::BodyLoadingFinished<!----></span><br>RemoteFrameOwner::AddResourceTiming<span class="line"><!---->RemoteFrameOwner::AddResourceTiming<!----></span><br>RenderFrameHostImpl::ForwardResourceTimingToParent<span class="line"><!---->RenderFrameHostImpl::ForwardResourceTimingToParent<!----></span><br><br>Obviously we don't need/have a NavigationTiming entry for an iframe that does not end up existing. But I imagine DocumentLoader will still exist for a failed iframe? Is it possible for loader folks to call the AddResourceTiming method on failure as well?<span class="line"><!---->Obviously we don't need/have a NavigationTiming entry for an iframe that does not end up existing. But I imagine DocumentLoader will still exist for a failed iframe? Is it possible for loader folks to call the AddResourceTiming method on failure as well?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Available)

          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>

        The cause for this seems to be:<span class="line"><!---->The cause for this seems to be:<!----></span><br>* The response that DocumentLoader gets for the error iframe is a chrome-error:// scheme, so not reported (we only report HTTP pages)<span class="line"><!---->* The response that DocumentLoader gets for the error iframe is a chrome-error:// scheme, so not reported (we only report HTTP pages)<!----></span><br>* Even if we were to report it, the response URL is the error URL, not the original request URL.<span class="line"><!---->* Even if we were to report it, the response URL is the error URL, not the original request URL.<!----></span><br><br>I'm taking a stab at fixing this.<span class="line"><!---->I'm taking a stab at fixing this.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The pending fix is:<span class="line"><!---->The pending fix is:<!----></span><br>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567925<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567925"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567925<!----></a><br>which make error documents to reveal informations to their parents, the same way normal documents does.<span class="line"><!---->which make error documents to reveal informations to their parents, the same way normal documents does.<!----></span><br><br>So to fix the cross-origin leak, we need to send more data toward the cross-origin parent? This sounds counter-intuitive at first, and potentially risky, since those are internal pages. We need to double check the cure is not worse than the disease.<span class="line"><!---->So to fix the cross-origin leak, we need to send more data toward the cross-origin parent? This sounds counter-intuitive at first, and potentially risky, since those are internal pages.         > So to fix the cross-origin leak, we need to send more data toward the cross-origin parent? <span class="line"><!---->&gt; So to fix the cross-origin leak, we need to send more data toward the cross-origin parent? <!----></span><br><br>Yes. As this information is exposed for iframes, not exposing it for some reveals information about them.<span class="line"><!---->Yes. As this information is exposed for iframes, not exposing it for some reveals information about them.<!----></span><br><br>> We need to double check the cure is not worse than the disease.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; We need to double check the cure is not worse than the disease.<!----></span><br><br>Makes sense to be sure.<span class="line"><!---->Makes sense to be sure.<!----></span><br><br>> What kind of new data will be sent to the parent?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; What kind of new data will be sent to the parent?<!----></span><br><br>We do report non-null startTime, fetchStart, responseEnd and duration, where startTime==fetchStart and duration == (responseEnd - fetchStart)<span class="line"><!---->We do report non-null startTime, fetchStart, responseEnd and duration, where startTime==fetchStart and duration == (responseEnd - fetchStart)<!----></span><br><br>name is the pre-redirect, pre-error URL<span class="line"><!---->name is the pre-redirect, pre-error URL<!----></span><br><br>> To be worthwhile doing, the new data should be indistinguishable from non-error pages. Is it the case?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; To be worthwhile doing, the new data should be indistinguishable from non-error pages. Is it the case?<!----></span><br><br>I believe so, other than timing attacks. But the current values I see would make sense also for non-error pages. (i.e. they are not extremely low)<span class="line"><!---->I believe so, other than timing attacks. But the current values I see would make sense also for non-error pages. (i.e. they are not extremely low)<!----></span><br><br>As the CL is now ready to land, let me know if y'all think it's safe to do.<span class="line"><!---->As the CL is now ready to land, let me know if y'all think it's safe to do.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug requires manual review: M88's targeted beta branch promotion date has already passed, so this requires manual review<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: M88's targeted beta branch promotion date has already passed, so this requires manual review<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<!----></span><br>6. Is this a new feature?<span class="line"><!---->6. Is this a new feature?<!----></span><br>7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<span class="line"><!---->7. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8.         We do need an entry for a failed request, as it is a security problem to enable distinguishing between successful and failed fetches. From what I understand the iframe entries are created from Navigation Timing for the iframe:<span class="line"><!---->We do need an entry for a failed request, as it is a security problem to enable distinguishing between successful and failed fetches. From what I understand the iframe entries are created from Navigation Timing for the iframe:<!----></span><br><br>DocumentLoader::BodyLoadingFinished<span class="line"><!---->DocumentLoader::BodyLoadingFinished<!----></span><br>RemoteFrameOwner::AddResourceTiming<span class="line"><!---->RemoteFrameOwner::AddResourceTiming<!----></span><br>RenderFrameHostImpl::ForwardResourceTimingToParent<span class="line"><!---->RenderFrameHostImpl::ForwardResourceTimingToParent<!----></span><br><br>Obviously we don't need/have a NavigationTiming entry for an iframe that does not end up existing. But I imagine DocumentLoader will still exist for a failed iframe? Is it possible for loader folks to call the AddResourceTiming method on failure as well?<span class="line"><!---->Obviously we don't need/have a NavigationTiming entry for an iframe that does not end up existing. But I imagine DocumentLoader will still exist for a failed iframe? Is it possible for loader folks to call the AddResourceTiming method on failure as well?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>

        The cause for this seems to be:<span class="line"><!---->The cause for this seems to be:<!----></span><br>* The response that DocumentLoader gets for the error iframe is a chrome-error:// scheme, so not reported (we only report HTTP pages)<span class="line"><!---->* The response that DocumentLoader gets for the error iframe is a chrome-error:// scheme, so not reported (we only report HTTP pages)<!----></span><br>* Even if we were to report it, the response URL is the error URL, not the original request URL.<span class="line"><!---->* Even if we were to report it, the response URL is the error URL, not the original request URL.<!----></span><br><br>I'm taking a stab at fixing this.<span class="line"><!---->I'm taking a stab at fixing this.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The pending fix is:<span class="line"><!---->The pending fix is:<!----></span><br>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567925<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567925"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567925<!----></a><br>which make error documents to reveal informations to their parents, the same way normal documents does.<span class="line"><!---->which make error documents to reveal informations to their parents, the same way normal documents does.<!----></span><br><br>So to fix the cross-origin leak, we need to send more data toward the cross-origin parent? This sounds counter-intuitive at first, and potentially risky, since those are internal pages. We need to double check the cure is not worse than the disease.<span class="line"><!---->So to fix the cross-origin leak, we need to send more data toward the cross-origin parent?         > So to fix the cross-origin leak, we need to send more data toward the cross-origin parent? <span class="line"><!---->&gt; So to fix the cross-origin leak, we need to send more data toward the cross-origin parent? <!----></span><br><br>Yes. As this information is exposed for iframes, not exposing it for some reveals information about them.<span class="line"><!---->Yes. As this information is exposed for iframes, not exposing it for some reveals information about them.<!----></span><br><br>> We need to double check the cure is not worse than the disease.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; We need to double check the cure is not worse than the disease.<!----></span><br><br>Makes sense to be sure.<span class="line"><!---->Makes sense to be sure.<!----></span><br><br>> What kind of new data will be sent to the parent?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; What kind of new data will be sent to the parent?<!----></span><br><br>We do report non-null startTime, fetchStart, responseEnd and duration, where startTime==fetchStart and duration == (responseEnd - fetchStart)<span class="line"><!---->We do report non-null startTime, fetchStart, responseEnd and duration, where startTime==fetchStart and duration == (responseEnd - fetchStart)<!----></span><br><br>name is the pre-redirect, pre-error URL<span class="line"><!---->name is the pre-redirect, pre-error URL<!----></span><br><br>> To be worthwhile doing, the new data should be indistinguishable from non-error pages. Is it the case?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; To be worthwhile doing, the new data should be indistinguishable from non-error pages. Is it the case?<!----></span><br><br>I believe so, other than timing attacks. But the current values I see would make sense also for non-error pages. (i.e. they are not extremely low)<span class="line"><!---->I believe so, other than timing attacks. But the current values I see would make sense also for non-error pages. (i.e. they are not extremely low)<!----></span><br><br>As the CL is now ready to land, let me know if y'all think it's safe to do.<span class="line"><!---->As the CL is now ready to land, let me know if y'all think it's safe to do.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users.         This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<span class="line"><!---->This bug has been closed for more than 14 weeks. Removing security view restrictions.<!----></span><br><br>For more details visit <span class="line"><!---->For more details visit <!----></span>https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage"><!---->https://www.chromium.org/issue-tracking/autotriage<!----></a> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<span class="line"><!----> - Your friendly Sheriffbot<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

    <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);

        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>
      <mr-description></mr-description>
      <mr-comment-list headinglevel="2"></mr-comment-list>
      
    <!----></mr-issue-details>


        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);

          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;

        mr-description {
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        mr-edit-issue {
          margin-top: 40px;
        }
      </style>

          Components:<strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Blink>HTML>IFrame Blink>Loader
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Components:</strong>
          
          Blink&gt;HTML&gt;IFrame Blink&gt;Loader
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        We do need an entry for a failed request, as it is a security problem to enable distinguishing between successful and failed fetches. From what I understand the iframe entries are created from Navigation Timing for the iframe:<span class="line"><!---->We do need an entry for a failed request, as it is a security problem to enable distinguishing between successful and failed fetches. From what I understand the iframe entries are created from Navigation Timing for the iframe:<!----></span><br><br>DocumentLoader::BodyLoadingFinished<span class="line"><!---->DocumentLoader::BodyLoadingFinished<!----></span><br>RemoteFrameOwner::AddResourceTiming<span class="line"><!---->RemoteFrameOwner::AddResourceTiming<!----></span><br>RenderFrameHostImpl::ForwardResourceTimingToParent<span class="line"><!---->RenderFrameHostImpl::ForwardResourceTimingToParent<!----></span><br><br>Obviously we don't need/have a NavigationTiming entry for an iframe that does not end up existing. But I imagine DocumentLoader will still exist for a failed iframe? Is it possible for loader folks to call the AddResourceTiming method on failure as well?<span class="line"><!---->Obviously we don't need/have a NavigationTiming entry for an iframe that does not end up existing. But I imagine DocumentLoader will still exist for a failed iframe? Is it possible for loader folks to call the AddResourceTiming method on failure as well?<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Status:</strong>
          
          Assigned
          (was: Available)

          <strong><!---->Owner:</strong>

        The cause for this seems to be:<span class="line"><!---->The cause for this seems to be:<!----></span><br>* The response that DocumentLoader gets for the error iframe is a chrome-error:// scheme, so not reported (we only report HTTP pages)<span class="line"><!---->* The response that DocumentLoader gets for the error iframe is a chrome-error:// scheme, so not reported (we only report HTTP pages)<!----></span><br>* Even if we were to report it, the response URL is the error URL, not the original request URL.<span class="line"><!---->* Even if we were to report it, the response URL is the error URL, not the original request URL.<!----></span><br><br>I'm taking a stab at fixing this.<span class="line"><!---->I'm taking a stab at fixing this.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        The pending fix is:<span class="line"><!---->The pending fix is:<!----></span><br>https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567925<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567925"><!---->https://chromium-review.googlesource.com/c/chromium/src/+/2567925<!----></a><br>which make error documents to reveal informations to their parents, the same way normal documents does.<span class="line"><!---->which make error documents to reveal informations to their parents, the same way normal documents does.<!----></span><br><br>So to fix the cross-origin leak, we need to send more data toward the cross-origin parent? This sounds counter-intuitive at first, and potentially risky, since those are internal pages. We need to double check the cure is not worse than the disease.<span class="line"><!---->So to fix the cross-origin leak, we need to send more data toward the cross-origin parent? This sounds counter-intuitive at first, and potentially risky, since those are internal pages. What kind of new data will be sent to the parent?<span class="line"><!---->I don't know anything about the PerformanceObserver, so I can't help much.         > So to fix the cross-origin leak, we need to send more data toward the cross-origin parent? <span class="line"><!---->&gt; So to fix the cross-origin leak, we need to send more data toward the cross-origin parent? <!----></span><br><br>Yes. As this information is exposed for iframes, not exposing it for some reveals information about them.<span class="line"><!---->Yes. As this information is exposed for iframes, not exposing it for some reveals information about them.<!----></span><br><br>> We need to double check the cure is not worse than the disease.<span class="line"><!---->&gt; We need to double check the cure is not worse than the disease.<!----></span><br><br>Makes sense to be sure.<span class="line"><!---->Makes sense to be sure.<!----></span><br><br>> What kind of new data will be sent to the parent?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; What kind of new data will be sent to the parent?<!----></span><br><br>We do report non-null startTime, fetchStart, responseEnd and duration, where startTime==fetchStart and duration == (responseEnd - fetchStart)<span class="line"><!---->We do report non-null startTime, fetchStart, responseEnd and duration, where startTime==fetchStart and duration == (responseEnd - fetchStart)<!----></span><br><br>name is the pre-redirect, pre-error URL<span class="line"><!---->name is the pre-redirect, pre-error URL<!----></span><br><br>> To be worthwhile doing, the new data should be indistinguishable from non-error pages. Is it the case?<span class="line"><!---->&gt; To be worthwhile doing, the new data should be indistinguishable from non-error pages. Is it the case?<!----></span><br><br>I believe so, other than timing attacks. But the current values I see would make sense also for non-error pages. (i.e. they are not extremely low)<span class="line"><!---->I believe so, other than timing attacks. But the current values I see would make sense also for non-error pages. (i.e. they are not extremely low)<!----></span><br><br>As the CL is now ready to land, let me know if y'all think it's safe to do.<span class="line"><!---->As the CL is now ready to land, let me know if y'all think it's safe to do.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        *** Boilerplate reminders! ***<span class="line"><!---->*** Boilerplate reminders! ***<!----></span><br>Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<span class="line"><!---->Please do NOT publicly disclose details until a fix has been released to all our users. Early public disclosure may cancel the provisional reward. Also, please be considerate about disclosure when the bug affects a core library that may be used by other products. Please do NOT share this information with third parties who are not directly involved in fixing the bug. Doing so may cancel the provisional reward. Please be honest if you have already disclosed anything publicly or to third parties. Lastly, we understand that some of you are not interested in money. We offer the option to donate your reward to an eligible charity. If you prefer this option, let us know and we will also match your donation - subject to our discretion. Any rewards that are unclaimed after 12 months will be donated to a charity of our choosing.<!----></span><br><br>Please contact <span class="line"><!---->Please contact <!----></span>security-vrp@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="mailto:security-vrp@chromium.org"><!---->security-vrp@chromium.org<!----></a> with any questions.<span class="line"><!----> with any questions.<!----></span><br>******************************<span class="line"><!---->******************************<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        This bug requires manual review: M88's targeted beta branch promotion date has already passed, so this requires manual review<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: M88's targeted beta branch promotion date has already passed, so this requires manual review<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/master/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<!----></span><br>5. Why are these changes required in this milestone after branch?<span class="line"><!---->5.            issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);

          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }

          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>

        for LitElement.

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
